definition: to force a plane to land
to force/to compel/to approach or go towards/urgent/pressing
to drop/to fall/to come down/to descend

sentences.english: Help me. I’ve crash-landed on an alien planet.
sentences.chinese: 救救我，我迫降在一个陌生星球上。

sentences.english: The pilot ditched the plane and climbed out on his raft.
sentences.chinese: 飞行员使飞机在水上迫降并爬出飞机乘上充气救生筏。

sentences.english: The plane's captain Chesley Sullenberger and first officer Jeffrey Skiles pulled off what is now regarded as the most successful ditching of a plane in aviation history.
sentences.chinese: 这次迫降被认为是航空史上最成功的飞机水上迫降。

sentences.english: The plane's captain Chesley Sullenberger and first officer Jeffrey Skiles pulled off what is now regarded as the most successful ditching of a plane in aviation history.
sentences.chinese: 这次迫降被认为是航空史上最成功的飞机水上迫降。

sentences.english: First, ensure that you have not crash landed on Earth.
sentences.chinese: 首先，确认你是否迫降在地球上。

sentences.english: “Better to land at an airport where there’s actual crash-fire-rescue, ” said the pilot, who requested anonymity because he did not have his airline’s permission to speak.
sentences.chinese: 最好还是在机场降落，那里有迫降起火救援的预案。

sentences.english: Please take off your high-heel shoes in an event of emergency landing.
sentences.chinese: 飞机紧急迫降时请把高跟鞋脱掉。

sentences.english: For ditching at night, a sea-light will be illuminated automatically.
sentences.chinese: 夜间迫降时，救生衣上的指示灯遇水会自动发亮。

sentences.english: Fog forced our Puerto Rico-to-New York plane to be diverted to Washington, D.C.
sentences.chinese: 大雾使得波多黎各飞纽约的航班迫降华盛顿。

sentences.english: The bad news is we're crash-landing.
sentences.chinese: 坏消息是我们得迫降了。

sentences.english: Chesley B. Sullenberger III, left, the pilot who landed USAirways Flight 1549 successfully in the Hudson River, celebrated withpassengers and crew members on the first anniversary of the splashdown.
sentences.chinese: 他与获救的乘客与乘务员参加成功迫降的一周年纪念。

sentences.english: The passengers swam for the shore when their aeroplane landed in the sea.
sentences.chinese: 飞机在海上迫降后，乘客奋力朝海滩游去。

sentences.english: Following a forced landing in Tianjin, passengers were ferried to Beijing by bus.
sentences.chinese: 当晚迫降天津后，乘客被分批乘客车送到北京。

sentences.english: Ditching is different from landing a glider.
sentences.chinese: 水面迫降和滑行着陆又有不同。

sentences.english: He and i were shipmates on a trawler once.
sentences.chinese: 第四架飞机在一艘荷兰拖网渔船旁迫降。

definition: (of an airplane etc) to fall to the ground and crash
(of a plane, ship etc) to have an accident (plane crash, shipwreck, vehicle collision etc)/to mess things up
to return to the point of departure
to fall into the ocean/to crash into the ocean
(of aircraft) to take off and land
